body: Seems like its trying to get data to often with the instant one, maybe add some kind of custom timer for how often it should request ?

http://prntscr.com/l1h00u 
these time frames are supported by bittrex, is it possible to config this ?

Hello mrgreedy911,

Actually it's strongly advised to use RealTime evaluators with a WebSocket. 
Currently Octobot has only one WS for Binance. 
You can follow WS developments on [this page](https://github.com/Drakkar-Software/OctoBot/wiki/Exchanges).

For you issue, its seems that your OctoBot lost connection with bittrex, it may require a WS.

> 
> 
> http://prntscr.com/l1h00u
> these time frames are supported by bittrex, is it possible to config this ?

To configure tentacle time frames you should take a look at the tentacle config file : 
tentacles/Evaluator/***TYPE_OF_TENTACLE***/config/***NAME_OF_TENTACLE***.json

For strategy tentacles you will find `"required_time_frames" : ["30m", "1h", "2h", "4h", "1d"] ` that is the list of configured TF for this tentacle.

Hi mrgreedy911,
For this issue: unexpected keyword argument 'force_TA_refresh', it is already fixed in the dev branch on the source code. 
If you are using the source code directly (not binary versions), switching to the dev branch will solve the problem.
It will also be solved in the next release. 
If you are using a binary version, you can for the moment solve it by replacing the **line 65 of the file tentacles/Evaluator/RealTime/Default/instant_fluctuations_evaluator.py**:
```python
self.notify_evaluator_thread_managers(self.__class__.__name__, force_TA_refresh=True)
```
with
```python
self.notify_evaluator_thread_managers(self.__class__.__name__)
```
Guillaume

Hello  mrgreedy911,

I can see "Account has insufficient balance for requested action." in your logs.
You should try the bot in simulator mode only [before activate real trading](https://github.com/Drakkar-Software/OctoBot/wiki/Trader).

Secondly, a well known bug on Windows for binance exchange due to a time lag is the cause of this error : "Timestamp for this request is outside of the recvWindow". The solution for this is to try to re-synchronize your computer date. You should take a look at [this issue](https://github.com/ccxt/ccxt/issues/850).

Thank you again for your feebacks.

Ok thank you.
Im trying out the dev build now
im getting 
```
 2018-10-04 18:45:17,675 ERROR    binance              error (Max reconnect retries reached) in web socket all_currencies_prices_callback, calling restart_sockets()
 2018-10-04 18:45:17,973 INFO     binance              2 web socket(s) restarted
 2018-10-04 18:46:07,006 ERROR    binance              error (Max reconnect retries reached) in web socket all_currencies_prices_callback, calling restart_sockets()
 2018-10-04 18:46:07,311 INFO     binance              2 web socket(s) restarted
 2018-10-04 18:46:57,735 ERROR    binance              error (Max reconnect retries reached) in web socket all_currencies_prices_callback, calling restart_sockets()
 2018-10-04 18:46:58,009 INFO     binance              2 web socket(s) restarted
```
after a while

If you are watching the Bitcoin cash currency, this problem is due to binance having it listed as bcc instead of bch. REST interface makes the conversion into bcc but websocket interface doesn't. it's solved already in the dev branch and will be released very soon. 

Thanks for using OctoBot !
You can follow the new release progress [here](https://github.com/Drakkar-Software/OctoBot/pull/419).
